contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox knot | name=Pile hitch | image= Pile hitch.jpg | names= | type= hitch | strength= | origin= | related= | releasing= | uses= Attaching rope to a pole or other structure | caveat= | abok_number= #1815 }} The '''pile hitch''' is a kind of hitch, which is a [[knot]] used for attaching rope to a pole or other structure. The pile hitch is very easy to tie and can be tied [[in the bight]], without access to either end of the rope, making it a valuable tool. To tie, form a loop in the bight, and wrap both strands of this loop around the pole near the pole's end. Pull the loop around and under the rope, then finish by putting the loop itself around the end of the pole. ==See also== *[[List of knots]] ==External links== *http://notableknotindex.webs.com/pilehitch.html {{Knots}} {{knot-stub}}
